subject: p18615099
History: -year-old man with hypotension and syncope, evaluate for acute process.
Findings: Single portable upright chest radiograph was obtained. Linear atelectasis at the right base is more discrete compared to prior exam. No consolidation, effusion or pneumothorax is present. Moderate cardiomegaly is stable. A tiny right effusion is noted. Surgical clips and sternotomy wires are intact. A left chest cardiac device has two leads in stable position.
